intro: Dichromena longa, commonly known as the long-stemmed dichromena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dichromena longa is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
